Grayson White is a doctoral student in the [Finley Lab](https://www.finley-lab.com) at Michigan State University. His interests are in small area estimation, hierarchical Bayesian modeling, teaching data science and statistics, applications of statistical methods to forestry and natural resources problems, and statistical software development.

## Education

**Michigan State University** | East Lansing, MI, USA

PhD in Forestry | Expected 2026

Advisor: Dr. Andrew Finley

M.S. in Statistics | 2025*

*: All course requirements completed, degree to be conferred summer 2025.

**Reed College** | Portland, OR, USA

B.A. in Mathematics (concentration Statistics) | 2021

Thesis advisor: Dr. Kelly McConville
